summary: This document is a forwarded email chain from the U.S. Marshals Service regarding a Freedom of Information Act request filed by T. McElwee via MuckRock.com on August 13, 2019, seeking all USMS records concerning federal prisoner Jeffrey Epstein. The request notes Epstein's widely reported death on August 10, 2019, and argues records should be released as he is deceased.

events.title: Reported death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein is widely reported to have died in New York City. The attached article from the NY Times is referenced.

events.title: FOIA request filed for USMS Epstein records
events.description: T. McElwee files a Freedom of Information Act request via MuckRock.com seeking all U.S. Marshals Service records concerning Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: USMS forwards FOIA request internally
events.description: A U.S. Marshals Service employee forwards the initial FOIA request email internally, attaching a news article about Epstein's death.

locations: Washington, MD 20530-1000 (U.S. Marshals Service FOIA Office address)
keyFacts: A FOIA request was filed on August 13, 2019, seeking all U.S. Marshals Service records on Jeffrey Epstein, federal prisoner Register Number 76318-054.

The requester, T. McElwee, argues that records concerning Epstein should be released as he was widely reported to have died on August 10, 2019, and thus exemptions for personal privacy no longer apply.
The request specifies searches of multiple USMS systems of records, including prisoner tracking, warrant, witness security, and internal affairs systems.
The document shows the request was forwarded internally within the USMS on September 12, 2019, with an attached New York Times article about Epstein's death.
